Text: Big Bone Lick State Park:  Mammoths are believed to have been drawn to this location by a salt lick deposited around sulphur springs.

Text: Big Bone Lick State Park:  Other animals including forms of bison, caribou, deer, elk, horse, mastodon, moose, musk ox, peccary, sloth, and possibly tapir also grazed the vegetation and salty earth around the springs that the animals relied on for their diet.

<Text: Big Bone Lick State Park:  While he assumed the bones were from ancient elephants, the local native traditions claimed the bones to be those of white buffaloes that had been poisoned by the salty water.>
